document.masterDocTitle: Water mites of the family Torrenticolidae (Acari: Hydrachnidia) from Thailand, Part II. The genus Monatractides K. Viets

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Water mites of the family Torrenticolidae (Acari: Hydrachnidia) from Thailand, Part II. The genus Monatractides K. Viets

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material. Thailand : Pong Creek crossing road to Muang Kong, Doi Chiang Dao, 477 m asl,
22 .xi.2007
, 19°
24.774 N
98 °
55.127 E
, leg. Smit 0/ 2 /0; stream near Haewsai Waterfall, Nam Nao NP, 425 m asl,
16 .xi.2007
, 16°
40.668 N
101 °
41.856 E
, leg Smit ( 1 / 5 /0) ( 1 / 1 /0 mounted); stream crossing road to Phu Goom Khao, Nam Nao NP, 803 m asl,
16 .xi.2007
, 16°
38.410 N
101 °
34.886 E
, leg Smit 10 / 8 /0 ( 1 /0/0 mounted).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 29–36.
Monatractides parviventris
(K. Viets)
, male, Haewsai Waterfall: 29 = dorsal shield; 30 = idiosoma, ventral view; 31 = anterodorsal portion of ventral shield; 32 = capitulum; 33 = palp, lateral view; 34 = palp, medial view; 35 = ejaculatory complex; 36 = I-Leg-5-6. Scale Bars =100 µm.

FIGURES 37–40.
Monatractides parviventris
(K. Viets)
, female, Haewsai Waterfall: 37 = dorsal shield; 38 = idiosoma, ventral view; 39 = palp, lateral view; 40 = anterodorsal portion of ventral shield. Scale Bars =100 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. The specimens from Thailand agree with
M. parviventris (
K. Viets, 1935
)
due to its large frontal plates (L/W ratio 2.5–2.7 ), which are longer than the shoulder plates (shoulder/frontal plate L ratio 0.94–0.96 ), the medial suture line of Cx- 2 + 3 is short in both sexes (ratio Cx- 1 medial L/Cx- 2 + 3 medial L 2.7 in male, 4.8 in female), P- 4 with well visible denticle near the insertion of the ventral hairs and Cx- 4 posteriorly extending far beyond the genital field.

Distribution . Indonesia , Sulawesi, Brunei , India (”
Torrenticola pusta ”
Cook 1967
), Sri Lanka (”
Torrenticola pusta ”
K.O. Viets 1973
). New for Thailand .
